summary: The United States has been building Afghanistan's security forces to help counter terrorist threats. Since 2005, Congress has appropriated more than $78.8 billion to build, equip, train, and sustain these forces. Concerns have been raised in Congress about the high cost of training contracts (about $4.3 billion so far). Officials told us that their original contracting approach made it harder for DOD to negotiate some...
title: Afghanistan Security Forces Fund: DOD Has Processes for Identifying Training Needs and Maintaining Visibility over Contracts
